By choosing a collection of kernels based on nested or more complicated linear subspaces generated by subsets of the Haar basis of L2(Z, dν), when Z = [0, 1] and ν is the Lebesgue measure on [0, 1], as in the paper by Fromont et al. (2011), this can be used to prove that our test is adaptive in the minimax sense over classes of alternatives (s1, s2) such that (s1 − s2) belongs to Besov or weak Besov bodies with various parameters (see Fromont et al. (2011) for more details).
